name: Center Parcs Whinfell Forest

reviews.text: Just returned from a four day break having stayed in a woodland lodge in Beechwood which included our three under five grandchildren. Our last visit we had stayed in Fell View and thought the accommodation was a bit jaded but we were not let down at this lodge which was very clean and the bathroom and shower rooms were very modern. Having been a number of times previously we knew what to expect entertainment wise and with the two older grandchildren we went to the teddy bears picnic, tots sports day, horse riding and pottery. At the end of that they really loved the free kiddies disco from 6.30pm to 8pm in the soft play area. Its £1.50p for a fruit shoot and £4.60p for a pint of lager in the soft play bar area so a round of drinks is not cheap but not excessive.
reviews.title: As good as ever

reviews.text: We booked the early check in which means getting into your lodge at 2pm as opposed to 3.30pm and by 2.30pm we had emptied the car and returned it to the main car park.
reviews.title: Centre Parcs Whinfell

reviews.text: Entry to your lodge is basically through a wristband that you swipe against the door handle which is great as you do not have to worry about keys. You can credit money onto these wristbands during your stay and use them to pay for services during your stay I must admit we didn't bother so I cannot comment as to how well it works.
reviews.title: Perfect all ages fun

reviews.text: All the staff as ever were friendly and helpful and I have no doubt we will return in the future.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.text: Accommodation was great , and the Kids really enjoyed facilities. (especially the pool). Recommend you try the geo-cache if you have not done so before. The food in the Rajinda Pradesh Indian was excellent. (even the kids remarked how nice it was.)
reviews.title: Wonderful views but awful accommodation

reviews.text: accomadation sub standard and filthy, far to over priced in all areas of the park eg shops restaraunts ammenaties staff very unpleasant and in some areas rude. i wont be returning to centre parks anytime soon because for what i paid for my break there with my family of six. i could of gone all inclusive for a wk to spain or turkey with my family and it would not of cost as much as being at centre parcs VERY DISAPPOINTED INDEED
reviews.title: robbed

reviews.text: My 12 year old daughter has a visual impairment and is at an age where she wants to exercise her independence when out and about. Centre Parcs is ideal with Whinfell as our main choice. The lack of vehicles and the priority of safety for people on foot allowed me to relax while she found her own way around the main complex and surrounding area. The staff were very helpful during all of the activities we challenged. They did this with discretion and untoward fuss. There was nothing she wanted to do that could not be made available to her. She took part in the Segways, Aqua Diving, Roller Blading and Nature walks. She had the full experience of all of these activities. The Segways is a little pricey at £30 each and although we will visit again I doubt we can include it every time.
reviews.title: A safe and welcoming holiday

reviews.text: The swimming changing area is a little daunting at first and she definitely could not access this independently. Although there are signs and arrows it still can be misleading with its avenues of doors and a strange changing cubicle door 'locking' system where you need wide arms to shut one door and the other at the opposite side of the cubicle and pull down a barrier which serves to lock both doors at the same time. Hard to explain, sorry. The apartment was clean and well facilitated with towels, toilet rolls, tea/coffee stuffs and washing up cloths etc, although in our room we had a dishwasher which they supplied with dishwasher tablets. The Senseo coffee machine was a nice alternative to kettle boiling.
reviews.title: Executive Excellence

reviews.text: We will go again mainly for the the safety and the activities for my daughter to experience where normally on holiday in other places, her independence is greatly curbed.
reviews.title: Won't be returning

reviews.text: Stayed at 25 Seven Pines. It was a huge house with 3 ensuites incl a whirlpool bath! The oven wasn't great (never really got hot enough even when set at max) so evening meals took an age to cook but apart from that it was perfect!
reviews.title: Great place - pity about the restaurant prices.

reviews.text: I booked this spa deal with my 2 friends for a surprise 30th birthday gift for our other friend
reviews.title: A fabulous girly day
Nice stay - shame about the spam
reviews.text: We had a ball, we arrived at 10.00am even though we could arrive at 9.00am and left the spa at 6.30pm feeling amazing.

reviews.title: First time
reviews.text: So four of us in total and one of our party was expecting.
The staff were very friendly the place smelt amazing and it was very clean.
reviews.title: short weekend break

reviews.text: When we checked in the lady on reception explained they still had appointment slots and special deal offers.
reviews.title: Wonderful family time

reviews.text: Its probably our 10th visit to centre parcs we love the holiday but for the first time left a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: family holidays

reviews.text: Loved the new technology in Penrith lodge keys and swimming pool lockers, accommodation good but hated the sports bar menu compared to other sites and in the past and standard of meals were not good.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: dined in the Italian very nice but side dishes we ordered didnt arrive and we booked a takeaway 3 oclock one afternoon for a 7 pick up not ready until 7.30 and when we got it back to the lodge dished missing again nobody wanted to go out in the rain again and spoil the meal
reviews.title: Excellent family break

reviews.text: Overall we spent in the region of £2000 for this holiday not really good enough
reviews.title: Just swim !!!!!!

reviews.text: Second time to whinfell forest now and it has been just as good if not better than last time.
reviews.title: We all loved it...

reviews.text: We [8 ranging from 3 to 66 in age] were at Whinfell over Christmas and apart from the delay checking in had a great time. We took ALL our food and drink with us which saved a lot of money. The men enjoyed the archery, the ladies the spa. The 3 year old loved story time and farmyard friends. The 8 year old had a great time quod biking but maybe the tree trecking was not such good value We all spent hours swimming and loved every minute.
reviews.title: A great Christmas break

reviews.text: This is our 3rd time back at Winfell our 1st was our honey moon which was fantastic, then we brought our children the following year, which we all really enjoyed, and this time we came with my wifes sister and there family a total of 8 of us, we arrived on the 23rd Dec until the 28th Dec it was such a magical experiance for the kids as well as ourselves, the time went so quickly, with alll the activities that were going on.
reviews.title: Thompsons

reviews.text: I would recomend the experiance to any family with children young and old, we are definatly booking up for the festive period next year
reviews.title: Christmas whinfellWww

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rubbish weather but other than that all enjoyed. Takeaway food expensive seen as a microwave meal and could buy cheaper in supermarket
reviews.title: Centre Parcs- Whinfell Forest

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Whinfell Forest for 4 nights on one of the Winter Wonderland breaks. We stayed in an Executive Penhouse Apartment which was very big, very clean and came with a daily maid service- we also had an excellent view from our balcony of the free fireworks show.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.text: We decided to visit centre parcs again having not been for some years, although our children grew up going to centre parcs 3-4 times a year , we stopped going when prices got high instead preferring holidays abroad for the same price. Although we enjoyed the break , the lodges do need money spending on them tvs need updating, what really took our breath away was bar prices our first round of drinks on the Monday evening was £16 for 4 drinks, the indian take a way prices were off the wall the supermarket take a ways r better value. all in all we dont think we will go back .... Sorry centre parcs poor value for money.
reviews.title: Prices high

reviews.text: A very enjoyable overall experience but the prices at the bars and shopping make it worth the effort to go off site to stock up.
reviews.title: Christmas 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge was very clean and the oven and fridge were spotless.
reviews.title: Mixed Views

reviews.text: The older style lodges have dated facilities ie TV and the oven is very slow at cooking even on full heat so makes the cooking and planning of any meals a long process.
reviews.title: Christmas at Whinfell

reviews.text: We have been staying at Center Parcs for almost 20 years and have visited all the sites in the UK. We love it so much we held our wedding reception at Sherwood!!
reviews.title: Christmas 2011

reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 day break over the new year. It's our 2nd visit as we stayed last year for the Winter Wonderland. We stayed at the bottom of the Badger Wood area this time which was quiet but an easy walk/cycle to the activities. The lodge was fine. Everything worked and was in good order. There was the odd scuff mark / stain here and there but everything felt clean considering the turnover of guests
reviews.title: Fabulous time

reviews.text: The changing area for the swimming pool is a vast improvement. Far more family changing booths and larger lockers from what I remember
reviews.title: Great New Year Eve Holiday

reviews.text: We ate lunch in the Lakeside Inn and the food / service was good. Our 4 year old loved the play area
reviews.title: new year at whinfell forest

reviews.text: We had drinks in Cafe Rouge and the service was good but we were unable to book a table for dinner at any of the restaurants on new years day. In the end the Lakeside squeezed us in and we had the carvery which was good
reviews.title: A good way to spend Christmas or a break!

reviews.text: I agree that the prices for food and drink are very inflated which leads you to self cater and stay in more
reviews.title: center Parcs whinfell New Year

reviews.text: We went to Whinfell for Christmas - 23rd to 30th Dec having loved our break at Sherwood last year. We were pretty disappointed. Everything felt very tired - and we were less than impressed with the cars all over the place daily. Managing a 4 year old on a bike and a 2 year old on a scooter was a nightmare when vehicles kept appearing - we thought there was a no car policy. We were in Meadow View - too too too far for little legs to walk to. It took us 45 mins most days to walk to the Village Centre with our toddlers. Adults can do it in about 15 but small kids, no way! Like others, the prices in the restaurants were a bit of a joke. We had 2 kids hot dogs and 2 for adults with coffees and the bill was £25 on day one. After that we cooked mainly for ourselves using food we'd bought at Sainsburys before we arrived. Shame really - it would have been nice to eat out more - £6.25 in Hucks for kids buffet is a bit steep. However, we had an amazing meal in Rajinder Pradesh on the one night we booked a babysitter. Worth the money on that occasion. Time out clubs were excellent - our 4 year old loved the parties he went to. We will go back to CP but not to Whinfell.
reviews.title: Whinfell not a patch on Sherwood

reviews.text: Booked a long weekend for new year celebrations, arriving 29th dec till the 2nd jan 12. This was a first and last time experience.. Arrived at our 3 bed lodge, which is in need of a refurb..tried cooking a meal!! But the cooker was abit temperamental and kept cutting out..the next day we went swimming which was ok, the children loved it.we booked our new years eve meal in hucks which was a total let down at £50 per head! The starter was a combo platter which the nacho's were soggy and the rest of it was over fried and hard which we sent back. The main meal was ok, steak and fries..the night in the restaurant didn't feel special at all and the service was poor..staff spent most of the time stood around talking to each other..then there was fireworks at the lake.. Really pushed the boat out!! Not!! Would of thought a place like center parcs would of put more on for a special occasion..the following day we decided to get breakfast in cafe rouge, big mistake!! We ordered 4 breakfast's which after 45 mins ask where they were, which we were told they would be another 5mins!! Didn't even ask if we wanted anymore drinks,to which we had to shout the waiter back over!! When they came out an hour after we had arrived they came out with some missing a sausage or beans?? The foreign waiter said this is what we had order it like, which it wasn't!! On my friends plate as she cut into which looked like an undercooked sausage some liquid squirted out of it. The egg was over cooked and the toast cold and like cardboard ..DISGUSTING!!! Later that night we ordered a takeaway.. The pizza and chips were freezing cold.. The service in the restaurants are really poor, half of them are foreign and don't understand you very well..Center parcs may of put a great winter wonderland on over Christmas but they really made no effort apart from the fireworks for new years eve!!! Would of expected more from a big company like center parcs..We will never come back!!!!! Waste of money!!! So over rated!!!
reviews.title: Center parcs terrible!!!

reviews.text: We usually visit Whinfell in October but had a swap round this year and went in between Christmas and new Year. Although there were a lot more people in the park, it was only really noticeable in the pool and restaurants and didn't detract from our stay.
reviews.title: winter short break

reviews.text: We used the takeaway service and pancake house for the first time this time and both were good. As usual the staff were quick and helpful.
reviews.title: great for the kids, not for the wallet

reviews.text: Aqua sana has to be the best Spa experience. I always leave feeling relaxed and warm even after only three hours.
reviews.title: Generally good but they're getting it all wrong on the pricing

aka: Center Parcs Whinfell Forest Hotel Penrith
